titleStmt.title: T. B. Cochran et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7491

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your petitioners respectfully represent to your Excellency that there is confined in the penitentiary a coloured woman ^named Sarah Smith^ convicted of larciny in Warren county for one year at July term 1865. recieved August 16th 1865 -- We understand the theft was coerced in some degree if not entirely by the threats of her husband who was a soldier -- or by Some white man

That she is in a family way & will probably be confined in a month -- If pardoned, we are assured by Capt Todd that he will give her sufficient money to take her home -- We therefore ask you to pardon her -- Decr 15th 1865 --

T. B. Cochran
W, R, Bradley
J H Prall
Jas R. Page
T. W. Hammond
Leslie Combs
R R Bolling
T. S. Chesnutt,
W A Dudley
Jos H. Chandler
O. P. Johnson
John L Helm
W T Combs
Geo A. Robertson
F. L. Cleveland
Henry D McHenry

Warren Cir Ct
vs
Sarah Smith
1 Yr
Larceny
Pardoned
15 Dec /65
